info.name: Dark Forest Tumblr Theme
info.description: A dark forest type layout for the dashboard and most other parts of tumblr that aren't actually blogs. Includes a hi-res background image perfect for larger monitors. If you're having spacing issues on the sidebar, try choosing 'no' on the "Slim Sidebar?" option. It's also important that you select 'no' if you use XKit's option to slim the sidebar instead. Otherwise, it's highly suggested you keep the sidebar slimmed as the buttons are horribly large by default. If you can't stand the background image in text areas select the option to hide it. I'm now using a code which should work more consistently than the previous version. Let me know via feedback if there's a page where it doesn't work.
info.additionalInfo: June 17, 2016 - Slim Sidebar and Slim Radar have been consolidated into one option, seeing how the sidebar is basically only the radar (and supposedly an ad? man, I love adblock!) nowadays. This option now squishes the sidebar back to a reasonable size and moves the content back closer to the center to counteract the fact tumblr's design team is composed entirely of two-year-olds with finger paints. January 2016 - Fixed toggle for the post button on top bar. July 2015 - For some unknown reason, tumblr has started using double the glass effect on reblog forms, which was leaving the dashboard underneath useless and still blacked out (or blued out, whatever) after the form disappeared; basically, this fixes that. April 2015 - Made my best effort to deal with the cluster(you-know-what) that is the new top bar. 12.04.14 - Fixes issue where post avatars were no longer showing. This does currently make the 'do you use xkit' function unnecessary, but I'm leaving it in case changes are made again. 11.10.14 - Fixes weirdness when choosing to hide the header's compose button. 10.31.14 - while I'd love to hope this new update is tumblr's Halloween Costume or something since it's so weirdly coded, there are elements I'm sure are here to stay regardless. Went ahead and drove myself crazy fixing the style. 10.13.14 - tumblr changed the class of the search bar; I've updated the style to apply to it again 09.11.14 - Fixed white parts showing in chrome where they shouldn't. 08.19.14 - Today's update brings minimal support for the search function, including an option to remove the blog results from displaying (off by default). I can't do much more with the search function, as I loathe this feature and avoid it myself, due to its inability to function well with my slower internet. I've also transitioned to a more inclusive moz-document rule which should require less upkeep but may be changed back if I find it's causing undesired style effects on odd pages of tumblr. Finally, I've tweaked and fixed up some places which were appearing the wrong colour etc. and changed the 'plexi' overlay for reblog forms etc. to a less obnoxiously clashing shade than the default tumblr blue. 08.14.14 - Once again having to fix issues caused by tumblr changing things up. Should no longer have the tumblr blue background. Second update today to fine tune the fix, so that you don't have unreadable settings pages. 07.27.14 - fixed a typo which broke this style on tag pages for ssl-secured accounts 07.22.14 - fixed some unreadable sections 07.21.14 - second update for the day; fixed post permalinks to no longer have traces of tumblr blue 07.21.14 - New option of themed 'new posts' and 'new mail' indicators! (code for this effect altered from Winter Stars by saibapanku) removing the background image from text editor is also now more stable and thus the recommended, default option; i'm leaving it optional, however, as I don't believe in removing choices just in case someone prefers the background appearing there 07.17.14 - fixing more frustrating breakage caused by unnecessary css class changes. (tumblr, please stop.) 07.10.14 - fixed the blog controls for SSL security enabled users. Sorry for the oversight! 06.27.14 - should now work with SSL security enabled 06.24.14 - deja bleepin' vu. more fixing of things tumblr's needless css class changes have broken 06.18.14 - fixed more breakage caused by more needless css class changes on tumblr's end. I'm starting to understand why so many tumblr themes end up abandoned by their makers, eugh. 06.17.14 - fixed breakage caused by a needless css class change on tumblr's end 02.06.14 - Fixed the recommended blogs, because tumblr thought it was a brilliant idea to switch from #recommended_tumblelogs to .recommended_tumblelogs 01.17.14 - Fixed the theme so that help pages are more readable. 01.15.14 - The new version of tumblr radar is now styled to match the theme. 12.16.13 - This latest update should fix compatibility with xKit's Read Posts extension which dims posts that you've already viewed. It should also fix an issue I recently encountered in which the content of post-reply notifications was squished and unreadable. 10.19.13 - After seeing some issues caused by the built-in sidebar slimming on my separate sidebar themes, I've decided to make it optional on my dash themes just to be careful. If this theme was working fine for you, with no weird or unmanageable spacing issues on the sidebar, feel free to skip this update and/or keep "Slim Sidebar?" set to the default option of 'yes.' Otherwise, you may wish to try selecting 'no' for "Slim Sidebar?" to see if that fixes the issue. 10.17.13 - 02 Fixed up the sidebar the best I could. Sadly, it's still chunkier than it used to be with my theme, but I've still slimmed it some and reinstated the difference in colours to combat tumblr's change toward a flat layout. Next I plan to try and fix the other elements that were borked by the change, such as notifications and the recommended blogs. 10.17.13 - I am so done with tumblr's changes, you cannot imagine... Had to destroy the section that slimmed the horribly large sidebar thanks to the updates. Am trying to figure out a way to reimplement it, but don't hold your breath. Sorry, everyone. 09.07.13 - Fixed a sudden change that was making avatar styling break. This may be xkit-specific, and if so I will update again to make the fix optional for xkit users. This is xkit specific, so please be sure to choose whether you use xkit or not. It defaults to yes, as I've noticed no errors from using the xkit-altered version without the extension. 09.07.13 - Now applies when browsing your likes beyond the first page. 08.30.13 - Fixed background image issue. It should now span the entire theme, and be less likely to break with future tumblr updates. Thanks to tumblr - Blog Controls Fix and Tumblr Controls Fix for helping me figure out an easier way to apply the background that won't break with tumblr updates. Previously, I was using individual page classes to bypass ruining the blog controls. 08.20.13 - Added options for icon shape and whether there's borders and/or shadows on them. IMPORTANT - May not remember to keep this updated. Pieced together with lots of bits. Contains a lot of stuff that only I'm likely to find useful or relevant. Basically I'm only even uploading this because I need it on Chrome and mobile. External Themes - Main screenshot features Supernatural Tumblr Bar in 'Black Out with Shadow,' Ultimate Whovian TARDIS Key Selector, Purgatory Tumblr Logo, Followers to Companions, and Ultimate Whovian Icons with XKit installed. You can have themed new post and mail count indicators by selecting 'yes' to the appropriate section. Code for this effect altered from Winter Stars by saibapanku.

options.label: Yes

options.label: Yes
